speaker: Narrator
line: A frail-looking young man sat on a rusty bench across from the police station, cradling a cup of real, plant-based coffee he could barely afford.

speaker: Narrator
line: Sunny had decided to pamper himself—after all, his life was coming to an end.

speaker: Narrator
line: He raised the cup, savored the aroma, took a tentative sip… and grimaced.

speaker: Sunny
line: Ah! So bitter!

speaker: Sunny
line: I should have bought a piece of real meat instead. Who knew actual coffee is so disgusting? Well. It's going to keep me awake, at least.

speaker: Narrator
line: He slapped himself to stay awake, cursed the purchase, then finished the coffee. Well-fed citizens rushed past, staring at his thin, pale figure.

speaker: Sunny
line: I guess that's what three full meals a day would do to you.

speaker: Narrator
line: With a slight grin, Sunny crossed the street and entered the police station.

speaker: Tired Officer
line: Are you lost, boy?

speaker: Sunny
line: No. As demanded by the Third Special Directive, I surrender myself as a carrier of the Nightmare Spell.

speaker: Tired Officer
line: Are you sure? When did the symptoms start?

speaker: Sunny
line: A week ago.

speaker: Tired Officer
line: Shit. Attention! Code Black in the lobby! I repeat—CODE BLACK!

speaker: Narrator
line: The Nightmare Spell first appeared decades ago, as the world recovered from disaster and war. Fatigue became slumber, then death—and the dead became monsters.

speaker: Narrator
line: The Awakened—those who survived their first trial—restored a fragile order. But for Sunny, poor and untrained, being chosen meant only death.

speaker: Narrator
line: Minutes later, Sunny was restrained in a vault room with armored walls. Officers watched with rifles as a gray-haired policeman entered.

speaker: Gray-Haired Policeman
line: What's your name, kid?

speaker: Sunny
line: Sunless.

speaker: Gray-Haired Policeman
line: Strange name. Do you want me to contact your family?

speaker: Sunny
line: There's no one. Don't bother.

speaker: Gray-Haired Policeman
line: Then listen carefully. Inside the First Nightmare, you'll meet monsters—and people. They're illusions, conjured to test you.

speaker: Gray-Haired Policeman
line: A lot depends on luck. Don't give up on yourself. Survive, and you'll gain powers. What you gain depends on your choices.

speaker: Gray-Haired Policeman
line: First thing: check your Attributes and Aspect. Combat Aspects are common. If not, others can still be useful—just be smart.

speaker: Gray-Haired Policeman
line: If you live, you're halfway to Awakened. If you die, a Nightmare Creature appears here. So please—don't die, Sunless.

speaker: Narrator
line: Sunny's eyelids grew heavy. He felt touched by the words, then slipped into darkness.

speaker: Nightmare Spell System
line: [Aspirant! Welcome to the Nightmare Spell. Prepare for your First Trial…]
